Description: Strip of a sheet of papyrus with hieratic text in black ink; part of a Late Ramesside Letter (short version or 'Communication'); there are two adjacent small fragments on the card, probably belonging to this item. The note concerns what is to be sent(?) to a chief of servants Nekh...amun: barley, clothes and seed.
Excavator/field collector: Field Collection by: William John Bankes
Curator's comments: Published: R.J. Demarée The Bankes Late Ramesside Papyri (British Museum Research Publication 155; London: British Museum Press 2005), 26, 58-59.

William John Bankes travelled in Egypt in 1815-1818, and is known to have collected papyri at Thebes on his second journey to Upper Egypt (1818). This papyrus is from a batch of Late Ramesside Letters acquired in 1818 by Bankes. It is still mounted on early 19th century coarse white paper, with the notation by Bankes himself marking it as document 'A' together with 75023, and the information 'From Thebes (2d. Journey) .. These and all the rest of those marked alphabetically were found together in one parcel'.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (139359) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/139359)
Taylor et al 2011 / The history and conservation of the papyrus of Tuy (p.98)
